item.title: Robocopy Examples
item.description: Robocopy Examples Robocopy has many command line options and it can be overwhelming to know which commands to use. In this post, we will take a look at how to ues robocopy to copy, mirror, purge Files and Folders.

item.title: Python Automation Android Calculator
item.description: Getting Started In the last post Appium Desktop Inspector – Part 2 we successfully used Appium Desktop Inspector to inspect elements to use for automating Android apps.

item.title: Appium Desktop Inspector – Part 2

item.title: Appium Desktop Inspector – Part 1
item.description: Getting Started Launch Android Studio run Virtual Device Manager Create Device if one already does not exist. Choose Hardware Choose System Android Image Version

item.title: Android Studio & Android SDKs
item.description: Installing Android Studio & Android SDKs for Windows This installation is based Android Studio Dolphin. Android Studio is the official IDE (Integrated Development Environment) for Android app development and it is based on JetBrains’ IntelliJ IDEA software.

item.title: Mobile App Automation
item.description: Setup Appium & Android Studio Windows Every app needs to be tested if they get updated frequently these use cases should be automated.

item.title: Set JAVA_HOME environment variable on Windows 10
item.description: Java Setup Install JDK and set JAVA_HOME Download the Java Development Kit (JDK) Then double click the JDK and follow all the installation steps.

item.title: Basic Setup VMware On-Prem Infrastructure as Code (Iac) - Part 1
item.description: DevSecOps On-Prem IaC A lot of applications are still on-prem and most resources available today for automation are focused on cloud and very little on traditional data center automation skills.
